The '''Desolation of the Morannon''' was the dead land that lay just before the gates of [[Mordor]] south of the [[Dagorlad]]. The terrible barrenness of the landscape was due to the labours of [[Sauron]]'s slaves, who had so defiled the land that it was diseased beyond repair. It was a foul place of horror for absolutely nothing grew in the polluted soil.  Pools of water were choked with ash and muds, slag-mounds of crushed and powered rock abounded, and cones of earth fire-blasted and stained with poison rose as if they were part of a graveyard.<ref>{{TT|Marshes}}</ref>

==History==
In {{TA|1944}} the [[Wainriders]] and men of [[Khand]] defeated the northern army of [[Gondor]] and killed King [[Ondoher]] of Gondor on a hill in the Desolation of the Morannon,<ref>{{UT|8a}}, twelfth, thirteenth and fourteenth paragraph</ref> on which King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] would later fight the forces of [[Sauron]] in {{TA|3019}}.<ref>{{UT|8e}}, note 16</ref>

[[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]], led by [[Gollum]], reached the Desolation of the Morannon on [[4 March]], {{TA|3019}}. The hobbits spent [[5 March|the next day]] hiding in sight of the Gate, and at dusk they resumed their route.<ref>{{App|Great}}, entries for the 4th and 5th of March of the year 3019 of the Third Age</ref>

The [[Host of the West]] camped in the Desolation of the Morannon on [[24 March]], {{TA|3019}} and fought against the forces of Sauron on the slag-hills in the Desolation of the Morannon on [[25 March]], {{TA|3019}}.<ref>{{App|Great}}, entries for the 24th and 25th of March of the year 3019 of the Third Age</ref>

==Inspiration==
[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] participated in the Battle of the Somme in 1916<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 334</ref><ref>{{L|165}}</ref> and remembered miles of seething tortured earth as described in the chapter about the approach to Mordor.<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 455</ref><ref>{{L|226}}</ref>
